content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Thomson Single Member Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Thomson Single Member Constituency** was a constituency in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The constituency was formed in 1959 and was abolished in 1991 ## History In 1959, the **Thomson Constituency** was formed. In 1988, it was renamed as **Thomson Single Member Constituency** as part of Singapore's political reforms. In 1991, it was abolished and merged into [Thomson Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Thomson_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Members of Parliament YearMember of ParliamentParty[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1959**T. Bani[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1963**Koo Young[BS](/wiki/Barisan_Sosialis)[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**Ang Nam Piau[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972****1976****1980**Chau Sik Ting**1984**Leong Horn Kee**1988** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election 1959](/wiki/1959_Singaporean_general_election): Thomson PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****T.
